displayProperties.subtitle: Warlock Vanguard
displayProperties.description: The wise Ikora Rey advises and outfits Warlocks as their Vanguard.
displayProperties.name: Ikora Rey

BungieNet.Engine.Contract.Destiny.World..subtitle: Warlock Vanguard
BungieNet.Engine.Contract.Destiny.World..description: The wise Ikora Rey advises and outfits Warlocks as their Vanguard.
BungieNet.Engine.Contract.Destiny.World..name: Ikora Rey

interactions.flavorLineOne: As you gave her the book you could swear you saw a hint of a smile on Ikora's face, but it's already gone.
Ikora gives a small smile at the familiar-looking confection. Perhaps her connection to the Traveler runs deeper than you thought.
Ikora is impressed by your dedication to accepting and completing bounties. She offers a reward to commemorate your efforts.

You changed the future—and in doing so, helped Ikora, Osiris, and Sagira change their present.

With a true friend by your side, the possibilities are infinite.

headerDisplayProperties.description: With renewed purpose, Ikora has resumed her role as head of Vanguard Research. Find her in the Bazaar and see how she's doing.
headerDisplayProperties.name: Ikora Rey

interactions.flavorLineOne:
Meditation comes in many forms. For some, it's reflection. For others, it's action. All that matters is that you take the time to be intentional about growing in the Light.

Complete daily and weekly challenges to test yourself and grow further in power.
There's a chill in the air, but Ikora's warm greeting is that of a friend. She rewards you for your performance, and wishes you a happy Dawning.
As the Dawning comes to a close, Ikora has one last reward to give to her favorite Guardian —and friend.
The Hidden already told Ikora all about your recent deeds. Your Light is an example to all.

Ikora realized that the more we learn, the less we know. She now reflects on past events and meditates on the bright future promised by a reborn and living Traveler. She has also found in you a friend, someone she can trust. For her, that can be rare. 

Return to Ikora Rey to relive past Red War activities.

To find Panoptes, you'll need a map of the Infinite Forest. Ikora believes you can find one in the Pyramidion on Io.

Retrieve the map by completing mission "Deep Storage" on Io.

Zavala has forbidden Guardians from traveling to the Reef for fear of starting a war with Uldren. So, officially, Ikora can't help you.

But unofficially, Ikora tips you off that Uldren and his Fallen Barons have gathered on a stretch of the Reef known as the Tangled Shore. If you want revenge, there's the place to start.

Take a hint from Ikora and investigate the Tangled Shore in mission "High Plains Blues."

You've rid the system of Cayde's killers, and Ikora sleeps easier at night because of it. But she still worries about the future of the Vanguard. The Hunters are without a leader. Zavala is more withdrawn than ever. And Ikora wonders if the worst is yet to come.

Ikora nods when you tell her about the malfunctioning frame. "Interesting timing," she says. "I just received a report from the Hidden that the Leviathan has deployed some kind of barge to the surface of Nessus."

She sizes you up. "If you want to investigate this on your own, I have no issue with that—but you're not going alone. Let me patch you the coordinates of the barge. I'll send other Guardians after you."
Ikora has received visions from the Traveler. And she's not the only one. She urges you to keep your eyes and mind open as you head to the Tangled Shore.
With a knowing look, Ikora hands you a package. "Aunor asked me to give this to you," she says, smiling.
Your reputation in the Crucible precedes you. Take this reward in recognition of your deeds.
